questions.question: 1. Explain the difference between an infinite potential well and a finite potential well.

answers.a: An infinite potential well has infinite energy levels, while a finite potential well has finite energy levels.
answers.b: An infinite potential well has infinitely high walls, while a finite potential well has walls with finite height.
answers.c: An infinite potential well has a continuous spectrum of energy, while a finite potential well has a discrete spectrum.
answers.d: An infinite potential well has zero probability of finding a particle outside the well, while a finite potential well has non-zero probability.

questions.question: 2. For an electron in an infinite potential well of width \( L \), calculate the energy of the second excited state (n=3).
3. What does the square of the wave function (|ψ|^2) represent in the context of quantum mechanics?

answers.c: The probability density of finding the particle at a given position.
answers.d: The force acting on the particle.

questions.question: 4. Given the wave function \( \psi(x) = \sqrt{2/L} \sin(n\pi x/L) \) for a particle in an infinite potential well, what is the probability of finding the particle in the first quarter of the well (0 to L/4) for the ground state (n=1)?
5. Why is the Schrödinger equation fundamental in quantum mechanics?

answers.a: It describes the energy levels of electrons in atoms.
answers.b: It governs the time evolution of a quantum system.
answers.d: It provides the basis for quantum field theory.
